title-group.article-title: Professional Wrestling: Moral Commentary Through Ritual Metaphor

abstract.p: Professional wrestling has taken North America by storm. It is recognized as a popular form of entertainment by people of various ages and backgrounds. In this paper I examine some of the metaphorical images and messages that combatants present to audiences through a series of ritual performances. I argue that professional wrestling is more than entertainment; it reflects, and sometimes helps create, a particular vision of North American values. It serves as moral commentary constructed, deconstructed, and reconstructed by a segment of the entertainment industry. I also argue that this commentary, at least in some cases, presents a strong political message. My aim is to unravel some of the ritual metaphors presented to the wrestling audience during the Persian Gulf Crisis.
